intro: Ugni roraimensis, commonly known as the Roraima huckleberry, is a species of flowering plant native to the tepuis of Venezuela and Brazil. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant produces small, edible berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Its leaves are typically dark green and glossy, with a dense, compact growth habit. Ugni roraimensis thrives in humid, high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests.
